intro: Saurauia tristyla var. oldhamii, commonly known as the Oldham's saurauia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
